body_html:
My PR to address this problem is already merged (Thanks to @prb12 and co) which makes RecvTensor ops to show up in tracing metadata. Chrome Tracing can visualize the RecvTensor ops. However, it removes the details of them (Source/Destination/Tensor Name/Size).

I have also developed a small tracing visualization tool which retains the details as well as separates network and computing ops.

An output example can be found here.
body_text:
My PR to address this problem is already merged (Thanks to @prb12 and co) which makes RecvTensor ops to show up in tracing metadata. Chrome Tracing can visualize the RecvTensor ops. However, it removes the details of them (Source/Destination/Tensor Name/Size).
I have also developed a small tracing visualization tool which retains the details as well as separates network and computing ops.
An output example can be found here.
body:
My [PR](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/14604) to address this problem is already merged (Thanks to @prb12 and co) which makes RecvTensor ops to show up in tracing metadata. Chrome Tracing can visualize the RecvTensor ops. However, it removes the details of them (Source/Destination/Tensor Name/Size).

I have also developed a small [tracing visualization tool](https://github.com/xldrx/tensorflow-runtime-metadata-visualization/) which retains the details as well as separates network and computing ops.

An output example can be found [here](http://htmlpreview.github.io/?https://github.com/xldrx/tensorflow-runtime-metadata-visualization/blob/master/example-inception-train-4w-1ps.html).

![Inception Timeline](https://github.com/xldrx/tensorflow-runtime-metadata-visualization/blob/master/example-inception-train-4w-1ps.png?raw=true "Inception Timeline")
